children: vaccine protects against HPV types that cause genital warts and cervical cancer (see General Internal Medicine).
Genital warts are typically painless, flesh colored, and exophytic. Diagnosis is made clinically.

Most infections clear spontaneously. Treatment does not prevent HPV transmission. Patient-applied agents include podofilox (podophyllotoxin), imiquimod, and sinecatechins. Physician-administered treatments include podophyllin resin, trichloroacetic acid, cryotherapy, and surgical removal.
